abstract.p: Hong Kong extends its recovery, reporting that economic output grew 10.8 percent in second quarter; government raises its forecast for full-year growth to 8.5 percent, from 6 percent (S)

block.p: Hong Kong has extended its recovery, reporting that economic output grew 10.8 percent in the second quarter. The increase is smaller than the 14.3 percent in the first quarter, but the government raised its forecast for full-year growth to 8.5 percent, from 6 percent. Some economists worry that price deflation continues in Hong Kong. The territory's exports surged 17.7 percent -- fueled by the strong United States economy -- and domestic consumer spending rose 5.2 percent.
